item.title: Erich add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I am Plato's Republic. Mr. Simmons is Marcus. I want you to meet Jonathan Swift, the author of that evil political book, Gulliver's Travels! And this other fellow is Charles Darwin, and-this one is Schopenhauer, and this one is Einstein, and this one here at my elbow is Mr. Albert Schweitzer, a very kind philosopher indeed. Here we all are, Montag. Aristophanes and Mahatma Gandhi and Gautama Buddha and Confucius and Thomas Love Peacock and Thomas Jefferson and Mr. Lincoln, if you please. We are also Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Erich add a quote by Mikhail Bulgakov
item.description: "If it is true that cowardice is the most grave vice, then the dog, at least, is not guilty of it." -- Mikhail Bulgakov

item.title: Erich add a quote by Mikhail Bulgakov
item.description: "manuscripts don't burn" - "(рукописи не горят)" -- Mikhail Bulgakov

item.title: Erich add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "That world is ended, as if it had never been. Let the race of Adam and Eve take warning." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erich add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No thanks," said Digory, "I don't know that I care much about living on and on after everyone I know is dead. I'd rather live an ordinary time and die and go to Heaven." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erich add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Wouldn't it be dreadful if some day in our own world, at home, men start going wild inside, like the animals here, and still look like men, so that you'd never know which were which." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Erich add a quote by Richard Matheson
item.description: "Full circle. A new terror born in death, a new superstition entering the unassailable fortress of forever. I am legend." -- Richard Matheson

item.title: Erich add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "<i>April the 4th, 1984. </i> To the past, or to the future. To an age when thought is free. From the Age of Big Brother, from the Age of the Thought Police, from a dead man - greetings!" -- George Orwell

item.title: Erich add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." -- George Orwell

item.title: Erich add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history." -- George Orwell

item.title: Erich add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf." -- George Orwell

item.title: Erich add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Big Brother is Watching You." -- George Orwell

item.title: Erich add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Doublethink means the power of holding two contradictory beliefs in one's mind simultaneously, and accepting both of them." -- George Orwell

item.title: Erich add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others." -- George Orwell

item.title: Erich add a quote by Ted Nugent
item.description: "When the law disarms good guys, bad guys rejoice." -- Ted Nugent

item.title: Erich add a quote by Ted Nugent (God, Guns & Rock'N'Roll)
item.description: "We experienced what can best be described as a legal orgy of firepower that day." -- Ted Nugent (God, Guns & Rock'N'Roll)

item.title: Erich add a quote by Ted Nugent
item.description: "If guns cause crime, all of mine are defective. " -- Ted Nugent

item.title: Erich add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Erich add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something." -- Plato

item.title: Erich add a quote by Ron Paul
item.description: "A system of capitalism presumes sound money, not fiat money manipulated by a central bank. Capitalism cherishes voluntary contracts and interest rates that are determined by savings, not credit creation by a central bank." -- Ron Paul

item.title: Erich add a quote by Ron Paul
item.description: "Truth is treason in the empire of lies." -- Ron Paul

item.title: Erich add a quote by Ron Paul
item.description: "One thing is clear: The Founding Fathers never intended a nation where citizens would pay nearly half of everything they earn to the government." -- Ron Paul

item.title: Erich add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Erich add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "If I had a dime for everytime that I was wrong, I'd be broke." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Erich add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "The only thing that gets me high is the musky scent of my enemy's fear" -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Erich add a quote by Alfred Bester
item.description: "I'm treating you like a relative. I don't pay enough for the privilege." -- Alfred Bester

item.title: Erich add a quote by Alfred Bester
item.description: "Be grateful that you only see the outward man. Be grateful that you never see the passions, the hatreds, the jealousies, the malice, the sicknesses... Be grateful you rarely see the frightening truth in people." -- Alfred Bester

item.title: Erich add a quote by Alfred Bester
item.description: "If a man's got talent and guts to buck society, he's obviously above average. You want to hold on to him. You straighten him out and turn him into a plus value. Why throw him away? Do that enough and all you've got left are the sheep." -- Alfred Bester

item.title: Erich add a quote by Alfred Bester
Erich add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa
